column4: ardchoille:take a look this is what happends... when i update i get maby 20 of these failed things
from the screenshot, i can only see the *wine* repository failing
could you please summarize the problem again for me?
well, then, instead of doing a screenshot, just type "sudo apt-get update" in a console, and pastebin the output. that's the same thing, but it's easier than taking a screenshot
wheres pastebin
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/11388/
uhm, there is no error in there. could it just have been a transient problem?
also, i see from there that you have the "edgy-proposed" repository enabled. that is a BAD THING, disable it now
what it is saying theres failed downloads.... not an eror but my quesiton was is it because servers are down
but in what you pastebinned there are *no* failed downloads
only in the screenshot
so perhaps any server problems are fixed now. try again from Synaptic, i guess
all the Ign one are the ones showing as failed
ex Ign http://archive.ubuntu.com edgy-updates/universe Translation-en_CA
well, those aren't fatal errors. anyway, pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list file and i'll see if it looks alright (no, i don't think that's a server problem anyway)
problems on the servers would give you totally different errors, not "ign"s
ok
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/11389/
your sources.list seems fine, and on my *own* system, the "Translation" parts also result in "Ign". if you ask me, i'd say everything's normal.
hum thats weird well ok
thx
